text: is a Japanese professional footballer who plays as a goalkeeper for Thespakusatsu Gunma in the J2 League. ==Biography== Kushibiki was born in Aomori on January 29, 1993. After graduating from Aomori Yamada High School, he joined J1 League club Shimizu S-Pulse in 2011. He played many matches from 2013. In 2016, he moved to Kashima Antlers. However there were few opportunities to play. In 2017, he moved to J2 League club Fagiano Okayama. In 2018, he moved to Montedio Yamagata. In August 2016, Kushibiki was selected the Japan U-23 national team for 2016 Summer Olympics. At this tournament, he played 1 match against Nigeria in the first match. ==Career statistics== Updated to end of 2018 season.Nippon Sports Kikaku Publishing inc./日本スポーツ企画出版社, "J1&J2;&J3;選手名鑑ハンディ版 2018 (NSK MOOK)", 7 February 2018, Japan, (p. 197 out of 289)Nippon Sports Kikaku Publishing inc./日本スポーツ企画出版社, "2017 J1&J2;&J3;選手名鑑 (NSK MOOK)", 8 February 2017, Japan, (p. 175 out of 289) Club Season League Emperor's Cup J.League Cup Total Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Shimizu S-Pulse 2011 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 2012 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 2013 20 0 2 0 5 0 27 0 2014 29 0 4 0 5 0 38 0 2015 10 0 1 0 2 0 13 0 Kashima Antlers 2016 0 0 0 0 3 0 3 0 Fagiano Okayama 2017 6 0 2 0 - 8 0 Montedio Yamagata 2018 24 0 0 0 - 24 0 Career total 89 0 9 0 15 0 113 0 ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1993 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Aomori Prefecture Category:J1 League players Category:J2 League players Category:J3 League players Category:Shimizu S-Pulse players Category:J.League U-22 Selection players Category:Kashima Antlers players Category:Fagiano Okayama players Category:Montedio Yamagata players Category:Footballers at the 2016 Summer Olympics
